page.title: 08St.Mary's Church Henham
page.content: The church is made of flint,clunch, timber and tiles. 28 pews in the church seat 200 people. Mr Green, the vicar here for 16 years, also takes services in Elsenham and Ugley.Services held :2 every Sunday, 1 more each fortnight, Holy Communion monthly.Times:8.00am:11.15am;6.30pm. Approximately 10 christenings, 8 funerals,6 weddings a year are held. The church committee consists of 11 people . Mr Furneaux, Mrs Atkins, Mr Norris play the 130 year old organ. Bell practice- Thursdays,Sundays.The bells were returned from the foundry on Thursday 4th July; a demonstration peal was rung, the first peal of bells for nearly a century.
